Description: One pendant and 12 beads made in different shapes and materials. A: Pendant in the shape of a poppy seed, made of carnelian. The perforation is acentric and broke through to the outer surface. Well smoothed. B: One short cylindrical bead made of corroded glass with a pearlescent colour. C: Double-conical bead made of white faience. D: Two long cylindrical beads, one in turquoise and one in red faience, good quality. E: Two flattened spherical beads, one made of white, one of blue faience. F: Three segmented cylindrical beads, two very thin, one slightly wider, made of turquoise faience. G: Three disc-shaped beads, made of ostrich eggshell.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
